com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.recovery

Interface RecoveryRequirementProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultRecoveryRequirementProvider

    public interface RecoveryRequirementProvider
    Implementations of this know how to relaunch tasks from a framework when those tasks crash or fail.

    The method getTransientRecoveryRequirements(List) is called once a given Task crashes. The implementation should look at the given List in order to know which Tasks it's replacing, and where that task's resources & data have been reserved.

    The method getPermanentRecoveryRequirements(List) is called once the framework's FailureMonitor decides that a task has permanently failed, and a new location is needed to run it. Typically, this means that if the task represented a database node, the data on that node is permanently lost.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<RecoveryRequirement> getPermanentRecoveryRequirements(java.util.List<TaskInfo> failedTasks)
      Returns a List that will replace Tasks whose Resources are no longer available given the List.
      java.util.List<RecoveryRequirement> getTransientRecoveryRequirements(java.util.List<TaskInfo> stoppedTasks)
      Returns a List that will relaunch Tasks which encountered a transient error.

    • Method Detail

      • getTransientRecoveryRequirements

        java.util.List<RecoveryRequirement> getTransientRecoveryRequirements(java.util.List<TaskInfo> stoppedTasks)
                                                              throws InvalidRequirementException
        Returns a List that will relaunch Tasks which encountered a transient error. This method should provide OfferRequirements which consume previously reserved Resources. This will only be called when the arguments are in a terminal state, before the FailureMonitor decides that Tasks are definitely gone forever.
        Parameters:
        stoppedTasks - The list of Tasks which have encountered a transient failure.
        Throws:
        InvalidRequirementException

      • getPermanentRecoveryRequirements

        java.util.List<RecoveryRequirement> getPermanentRecoveryRequirements(java.util.List<TaskInfo> failedTasks)
                                                              throws InvalidRequirementException
        Returns a List that will replace Tasks whose Resources are no longer available given the List.
        Parameters:
        failedTasks - The list of Tasks which have encountered a permanent failure.
        Throws:
        InvalidRequirementException
